DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care._An arbitrary classification of taxonomic group that is a division of a species; usually arise as a consequence of geographical isolation within a species and characterised by shared heredity, physical attributes and behavior, and in case of humans, by common history, nationality, or geographic distribution.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: An arbitrary classification of taxonomic group that is a division of a species; usually arise as a consequence of geographical isolation within a species and characterised by shared heredity, physical attributes and behavior, and in case of humans, by common history, nationality, or geographic distribution.

Concepts.definition: A geographic ancestral origin category that is assigned to a population group based mainly on physical characteristics that are thought to be distinct and inherent.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Major living subspecies of man differentiated by genetic and physical characteristics. There are four racial groups: Australoid, Caucasoid, Mongoloid, and Negroid._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America) and who maintains tribal affiliation or community attachment. (OMB)

Concepts.definition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America) and who maintains tribal affiliation or community attachment. (OMB)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian subcontinent, including for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam. (OMB)

Concepts.definition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian subcontinent, including for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam. (OMB)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa. (OMB)

Concepts.definition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa. (OMB)

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: 10.12.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED WITHDRAWN to RETIRED ARCHIVED in preparation of OneData. Use existing NCIt based VM instead

PermissibleValues.value: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, or other Pacific Islands. (OMB)

Concepts.longName: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Concepts.definition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, or other Pacific Islands. (OMB)

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: 10.12.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED WITHDRAWN to RETIRED ARCHIVED in preparation of OneData. Use existing NCIt based VM instead- dw 12-30-2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person having origins in any of the Black racial groups of Africa. Terms such as "Haitian" or "Negro" can be used in addition to "Black or African American". (OMB)

Concepts.definition: A person having origins in any of the Black racial groups of Africa. Terms such as "Haitian" or "Negro" can be used in addition to "Black or African American". (OMB)

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added "Black or" to VM Long Name for CDISC Implementation, 10.31.18 mc

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Major living subspecies of man differentiated by genetic and physical characteristics. There are four racial groups: Australoid, Caucasoid, Mongoloid, and Negroid.:Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A geographic ancestral origin category that is assigned to a population group based mainly on physical characteristics that are thought to be distinct and inherent.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
